org.hps.analysis.ecal.cosmic

Class DualThresholdSignalFitDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.analysis.ecal.cosmic.DualThresholdSignalFitDriver

  • public class DualThresholdSignalFitDriver
extends Driver

    This Driver will perform a function fit on ECAL window mode data to determine the likelihood of a signal being present, e.g. from a cosmic ray MIP signal. By default, the mean and sigma are fixed in the fit, and the pedestal and normalization are allowed to float. The pedestal can also be configured as fixed using the setFixPedestal(boolean) method.

    Those hits with a signal significance greater than a settable threshold (by default set to 4 sigma) will be written into an output collection of selected hits that can be used by other Drivers.

    • Nested Class Summary

        public void setMinimumHits(int minimumHits)
        Set the minimum number of required hits to continue processing this event. By default this is 3 hits.
        Parameters:
        minimumHits - The minimum number of hits.

      • setFixPedestal

        public void setFixPedestal(boolean fixPedestal)
        Set whether the pedestal is fixed in the signal fit. By default this is false.
        Parameters:
        fixPedestal - True to fix the pedestal in the signal fit.

      • startOfData

        public void startOfData()
        Perform start of job initialize. The DataPointSet for the ADC values is initialized and global fit parameters are set here.
        Overrides:
        startOfData in class Driver

      • process

        public void process(EventHeader event)
        Process the event, performing a signal fit for every raw data hit in the input collection. The hits that pass the sigma selection cut are added to a new hits collection, which can be converted to a CalorimeterHit collection and then clustered.
        Overrides:
        process in class Driver
        Throws:
        NextEventException - if there are not enough hits that pass the selection cut.

      • fitAdcSamples

        hep.aida.IFitResult fitAdcSamples(EcalChannel channel,
                                  hep.aida.IDataPointSet adcDataPointSet)
        Fit all of the ADC samples in a hit using a DataPointSet and then return the fit result.
        Parameters:
        channel - The ECAL channel conditions information.
        adcDataPointSet - The DataPointSet to use for the fit containing all 100 ADC samples.
        Returns:
        The significance which is the normalization divided by its error.
